wikitext.*:
On [[7 July]] [[1946]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to G.E. Selby'''.<ref name=CG>{{CG|C}}, p. 301</ref><ref name=TB/>

*'''Subject:''' Academic matters and a recent holiday with [[Edith Tolkien|Edith]].<ref name=CG/><ref name=TB/>

*'''Publication:''' Extracts from the letter appeared in ''[[Sotheby's Nineteenth Century and Modern First Editions, Presentation Copies, Autograph Letters and Literary Manuscripts 28-29 July 1977]]'',<ref name=TB>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=63320|articlename=Nineteenth Century and Modern First Editions.1977|dated=|website=TB|accessed=28 January 2013}}</ref> in ''[[Soteby's Catalogue of Printed Books, Manuscripts and Music 27 May and 10 June 1986]]'',<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=65880|articlename=Printed Books, Manuscripts and Music. 1986 |dated=|website=TB|accessed=28 January 2013}}</ref> and in ''[[Maggs Bros. Autograph Letters and Historical Documents|Maggs Bros. Autograph Letters & Historical Documents]]'' (Catalogue 1086, printed in 1988). A summary of the letter was provided by [[Christina Scull]] and [[Wayne G. Hammond]] in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide|The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology]]''.<ref name=CG/>
